query: What do I do with the fat skimmed off from the strained stock of chicken?
text: Relevant Information: ladle Information Type: equipment Instruction: Using a ladle, carefully skim off a few tablespoons of fat from the strained stock and add it to the Dutch oven (it's okay if a little stock gets in as well). Step: 4. Using a ladle, carefully skim off a few tablespoons of fat from the strained stock and add it to the Dutch oven (it's okay if a little stock gets in as well). Heat over high heat, swirling and stirring until the watery stock completely evaporates and starts to form a browned layer in the bottom of the pan. (It will spatter a bit. The more you stir, the less it will spatter.) As soon as the chicken fat starts to smoke, pour in the contents of the blender all at once and cook, stirring, for about 15 seconds (it will spatter a lotâ€”wear an apron!). Immediately pour in strained chicken stock and fat and stir to combine. Bring to a bare simmer, stir in hominy, season to taste with salt, and keep warm.

query: What do you combine the olive with?
text: Relevant Information: 1/4 cup olive Information Type: ingredient Instruction: In a large straight-sided sautÃ© pan or skillet, combine olive oil, garlic, and anchovies (if using). Step: 1. In a large straight-sided sautÃ© pan or skillet, combine olive oil, garlic, and anchovies (if using). Cook over medium-low heat, stirring and breaking up anchovies occasionally with a wooden spoon, until anchovies have dissolved and garlic has softened and is just beginning to turn lightly golden, about 5 minutes. Add red pepper flakes and continue to cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Increase heat to medium-high and add wine. Bring to a simmer and cook, swirling pan and scraping up any stuck-on bits with a wooden spoon, until wine has emulsified with olive oil and mixture is slightly reduced, about 30 seconds.

query: How should I properly cook the pasta to maintain the right texture?
text: Relevant Information: pot Information Type: equipment Instruction: Meanwhile, in a pot of salted boiling water, cook pasta until softened on the exterior, but well shy of al dente and still uncooked in the center (about 3 minutes less than the package directions). Meanwhile, in a pot of salted boiling water, cook pasta until softened on the exterior, but well shy of al dente and still uncooked in the center (about 3 minutes less than the package directions). query: How should I start preparing the carrots?
text: Relevant Information: oven Information Type: equipment Instruction: Add thyme sprigs to pan, drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil, toss to coat, and transfer to oven. Step: 1. For the Carrots: Adjust oven rack center position and preheat oven to 400Â°F. Place carrots in a large skillet and cover with cold water. Season gently with salt. Bring to a boil and cook until carrots are tender and water has mostly evaporated (If there's still lots of water left after the carrots are fully tender, drain.) Season cooked carrots with salt and pepper. Add thyme sprigs to pan, drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil, toss to coat, and transfer to oven. query: What technique is used to cook the carrots in the skillet?
text: Relevant Information: large skillet Information Type: equipment Instruction: Place carrots in a large skillet and cover with cold water. Step: 1. For the Carrots: Adjust oven rack center position and preheat oven to 400Â°F. Place carrots in a large skillet and cover with cold water. Season gently with salt. Bring to a boil and cook until carrots are tender and water has mostly evaporated (If there's still lots of water left after the carrots are fully tender, drain.) Season cooked carrots with salt and pepper. Add thyme sprigs to pan, drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil, toss to coat, and transfer to oven. Roast, turning occasionally, until carrots are lightly caramelized and wrinkled in appearance, about 30 minutes. Remove from oven, discard thyme, and set aside. Reduce oven temperature to 350Â°F.

query: what should I reduce the temperature to when cooking carrots in a skillet?
text: Relevant Information: to 350Â°F Information Type: temperature Instruction: Reduce oven temperature to 350Â°F. Step: 1. For the Carrots: Adjust oven rack center position and preheat oven to 400Â°F. Place carrots in a large skillet and cover with cold water. Season gently with salt. Bring to a boil and cook until carrots are tender and water has mostly evaporated (If there's still lots of water left after the carrots are fully tender, drain.) Season cooked carrots with salt and pepper. Add thyme sprigs to pan, drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil, toss to coat, and transfer to oven. Roast, turning occasionally, until carrots are lightly caramelized and wrinkled in appearance, about 30 minutes. Remove from oven, discard thyme, and set aside. Reduce oven temperature to 350Â°F.

query: What will signify that the dish is cooked in the oven?
text: Relevant Information: 1 1/2 pounds carrots Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Bring to a boil and cook until carrots are tender and water has mostly evaporated (If there's still lots of water left after the carrots are fully tender, drain.) Step: 1. For the Carrots: Adjust oven rack center position and preheat oven to 400Â°F. Place carrots in a large skillet and cover with cold water. Season gently with salt. Bring to a boil and cook until carrots are tender and water has mostly evaporated (If there's still lots of water left after the carrots are fully tender, drain.) Season cooked carrots with salt and pepper. Add thyme sprigs to pan, drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil, toss to coat, and transfer to oven. query: What are the steps to make the gravy?
text: Relevant Information: 2 tablespoons olive Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Combine 3 tablespoons olive oil and flour in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat and cook, stirring constantly with a whisk until flour is nutty brown, about 3 minutes. text: Relevant Information: 2 minutes Information Type: time Instruction: Toast, tossing frequently, until spices are quite fragrant, about 1 to 2 minutes. Step: 4. query: what sort of oil should be used for the pasta?
text: Relevant Information: 1/4 cup olive Information Type: ingredient Instruction: In a large straight-sided sautÃ© pan or skillet, combine olive oil, garlic, and anchovies (if using). Step: 1. In a large straight-sided sautÃ© pan or skillet, combine olive oil, garlic, and anchovies (if using). Cook over medium-low heat, stirring and breaking up anchovies occasionally with a wooden spoon, until anchovies have dissolved and garlic has softened and is just beginning to turn lightly golden, about 5 minutes. Add red pepper flakes and continue to cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Increase heat to medium-high and add wine. Bring to a simmer and cook, swirling pan and scraping up any stuck-on bits with a wooden spoon, until wine has emulsified with olive oil and mixture is slightly reduced, about 30 seconds.

query: how much less should I cook the pasta so that it is shy of al dente?
text: Relevant Information: about 3 minutes Information Type: time Instruction: Meanwhile, in a pot of salted boiling water, cook pasta until softened on the exterior, but well shy of al dente and still uncooked in the center (about 3 minutes less than the package directions). Meanwhile, in a pot of salted boiling water, cook pasta until softened on the exterior, but well shy of al dente and still uncooked in the center (about 3 minutes less than the package directions). query: How can I incorporate the wine into the pasta mixture?
text: Relevant Information: mixture Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Bring to a simmer and cook, swirling pan and scraping up any stuck-on bits with a wooden spoon, until wine has emulsified with olive oil and mixture is slightly reduced, about 30 seconds. query: What should I do with the turkey skin after removing it?
text: Relevant Information: 5 pounds turkey Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Carefully remove turkey skin in a single piece and set aside. Step: 1. text: Relevant Information: medium saucepan Information Type: equipment Instruction: In a medium saucepan over high heat, heat oil until smoking. Step: 6. For the Gravy: Using a cleaver, chop breastbone into 1-inch chunks. In a medium saucepan over high heat, heat oil until smoking.
